timing.notes: 03z init. Nashville EF3 touchdown 06:32 UTC = F3.5. Peak activity 06:30-08:30 UTC = F3-F5.5. Cookeville EF4 later. Nocturnal: storms already forming at init. F0-F1 capture LLJ buildup. hero_fhr=3. Full outbreak through F8 (11z). Extended trimmable through F18 for post-frontal environment.

18z init. First tornado ~18z = F0. Peak 21z-03z = F3-F9. 141 tornadoes across 10 states including Bassfield-Soso EF4 (68mi track). hero_fhr=5. Already had timing data. Extended essential to F12 for overnight continuation. Trimmable through F24 for next-day residual activity.

02z init. Tornado struck at 04:40 UTC = F2.7. Peak 04:40-04:55 = F2.7-F2.9. hero_fhr=2. Nocturnal LLJ-driven supercell. F0-F1 capture pre-tornado shear buildup. F2-F4 is the active tornado window. F5-F6 for post-tornado environment and any subsequent activity. Trimmable covers rest of overnight into morning.

15z init. First tornado 20z = F5. Peak 20z-23z = F5-F8. hero_fhr=3 (section best_fhr). Notes say FHR 5-8. 12 tornadoes across Birmingham metro. F0-F4 captures morning through early afternoon instability buildup (CAPE >2000 J/kg, warm sector development). F5-F8 is peak tornado window. F9-F10 for late activity.

01z init. Tornado touchdown 04:37 UTC Mar 26 = F3.6 after 01z. Peak 04:50-05:15 = F3.8-F4.25. hero_fhr=1 (section best_fhr). Notes say 01z at FHR 3-5. Nocturnal EF4 with 53min duration, 39mi track. F0-F2 capture nocturnal LLJ enhancement and pre-tornado environment. F3-F5 is the active tornado window with 170mph winds. F6-F7 captures dissipation and continued outbreak activity.

00z init. First tornado 01z Dec 11 = F1. Peak 03-05z = F3-F5. hero_fhr=3. Already had timing data. 166-mile track across 4 states over 4 hours. 71 tornadoes in outbreak. F0-F1 for buildup. F1-F5 core of Quad-State tornado. F6-F8 for continued outbreak activity. Trimmable extends to F18 for full overnight period.

23z init. Tornado at 02:27 UTC Dec 11 = F3.45 after 23z. Peak 02:27-02:35 = F3.5. hero_fhr=5. Same historic outbreak as Quad-State. Amazon warehouse collapse killed 6. F0-F2 captures pre-storm environment and St. Louis metro instability. F3-F5 is the active tornado/warehouse collapse window. F6-F7 for continued outbreak activity. Extended trimmable through F18.

18z init. First tornado 22:26 UTC = F4.4. Peak 22:30-00:00 = F4.5-F6. hero_fhr=5. Already had timing data. 70mi track, 94min on ground. Cold-core setup with extreme low-level CAPE. F0-F3 captures moisture return and boundary layer destabilization. F4-F6 is the peak tornado window. F7-F8 for continued track into Newton. Trimmable extends through F24.

22z init. Tornado at 01:10 UTC Apr 30 = F3.2 after 22z. Peak 01:10-01:31 = F3.2-F3.5. hero_fhr=4 (fhr_offset=4 from 18z archive). Notes say 22z at FHR 0-2 or 21z FHR 1-3. Dryline-initiated supercell east of Wichita. F0-F1 captures dryline and instability. F2-F4 is the active tornado window. F5-F6 for post-tornado environment.

22z init. Tornado at 01:00 UTC Mar 25 = F3 after 22z. Peak 01:15-02:00 = F3.25-F4. hero_fhr=4. High-end EF4 at 195mph, 59mi track. Evening onset transitioning to nocturnal. F0-F1 for pre-storm environment setup. F2-F5 core tornado window through Rolling Fork, Midnight, Silver City. F6-F7 for continued outbreak activity (32 tornadoes total). Trimmable through F18.

22z init. Tornado at 00:50 UTC Jun 22 = F2.8 after 22z. Peak 01:00-01:10 = F3. hero_fhr=4. Already had essential_fhrs data. High Plains dryline supercell. F0-F1 captures late afternoon heating and dryline convergence. F2-F5 is the supercell and tornado window. Same cell also produced 109mph winds and 4-inch hail. F6-F7 for post-storm environment.

15z init. First tornado 18z = F3. Peak 19:41-20:49 UTC = F4.7-F5.8. hero_fhr=3 (section best_fhr). Notes say FHR 4-7. 39 tornadoes including Clarksville EF3 (47.75mi track, 150mph). Late-season December outbreak with summer-like instability. F0-F3 captures morning instability buildup with anomalous December warmth. F4-F8 is the peak tornado activity window. F9-F10 for continued outbreak. Trimmable through F18.

18z init. First tornado 20:30 UTC = F2.5. Peak 20:49-21:29 = F2.8-F3.5. hero_fhr=3. Already had timing data. 32mi track through Omaha metro, 1900yd wide. Zero fatalities despite urban path. F0-F1 captures frontal advance and instability. F2-F5 is peak tornado window. F6-F8 for continued outbreak (35 tornadoes total). Trimmable extends through F24.

01z init. Sulphur EF3 at 03:25 UTC = F2.4. Marietta EF4 at 04:08+ UTC = F3+. Peak 03:25-05:00 = F2.4-F4. hero_fhr=1 (section best_fhr). Notes say 01z at FHR 2-4 or 00z at FHR 3-5. Nocturnal event with two violent tornadoes. F0-F1 for nocturnal LLJ enhancement and pre-tornado setup. F2-F5 for both Sulphur EF3 and Marietta EF4 tornado windows. F6-F7 for continued overnight activity. Part of April 25-28 outbreak.

23z init. Tornado at 02:12 UTC May 7 = F3.2 after 23z. Peak 02:30-03:00 = F3.5-F4. hero_fhr=5 (from 18z archive). Notes say 23z at FHR 3-4 or 00z at FHR 2-4. 180mph EF4, 40.8mi nocturnal track. Triple-point initiation. F0-F2 for pre-tornado dryline/warm front environment and LLJ buildup. F3-F6 is the active tornado window including rapid EF1-to-EF4 intensification. F7 for dissipation. Part of May 6-10 100+ tornado outbreak.

17z init. First tornado 21z = F4. Peak 21:30-22:00 = F4.5-F5. hero_fhr=5. Notes say 17z at FHR 4-6 or 18z at FHR 3-5. DOW-measured 309-318mph (3rd ever 300mph+ observation). 42.4mi track, 48min. F0-F3 captures afternoon heating, dryline/warm front intersection, CAPE >3000 J/kg buildup. F4-F6 is the peak tornado window. F7-F8 for continued activity (13 tornadoes total).

00z init (synoptic, max F48). First tornado 04:30 UTC May 26 = F4.5. Peak 05:00-06:30 = F5-F6.5. hero_fhr=17 (previously evaluated for broader outbreak context). Nocturnal 48mi long-track EF3, 7 dead at I-35 truck stop and mobile home park. F0-F3 captures evening environment setup and LLJ acceleration. F4-F7 is the actual nocturnal tornado window (Valley View devastation). F8-F15 covers morning transition and environment evolution. F16-F20 captures any continued daytime convection per previously curated hero_fhr=17. Part of May 19-27 outbreak sequence.

14z init. First tornado 17:17 UTC = F3.3 after 14z. Peak 17:30-18:30 = F3.5-F4.5. hero_fhr=2 (section best_fhr). Notes say 14z at FHR 3-5. 67mi track, 80min, 170mph EF4. F0-F2 for morning instability buildup and warm front setup. F3-F5 is the peak tornado window through Kentwood, Tylertown. F6-F8 for continued outbreak (100+ tornadoes). Trimmable through F18.

17z init. Tornado at 19:41 UTC = F2.7 after 17z. Peak 19:45-20:15 = F2.75-F3.25. hero_fhr=5 (section best_fhr). Notes say 17z FHR 2-4 or 18z FHR 1-3. First St. Louis metro tornado since 1959. $1.6B damage. 23mi track through urban core. F0-F1 captures warm front and instability setup. F2-F5 is peak tornado window (Clayton through Edwardsville). F6-F8 for continued outbreak activity (10 tornadoes). Same outbreak as Somerset-London EF4.

01z init. Tornado at 02:57 UTC May 17 = F1.95. Peak 03:30-04:30 = F2.5-F3.5. hero_fhr=1 (section best_fhr). Notes say 01z FHR 0-3 or 00z FHR 3-6. Nocturnal EF4, 60mi track, 1700yd wide, 90min. 19 dead. Debris to 27,000ft. F0-F1 for nocturnal LLJ ramp-up and pre-tornado shear. F2-F5 is peak tornado window (Somerset through London). F6-F8 for continued activity (20 tornadoes in outbreak). Deadliest US tornado since 2021 Quad-State.
